intro: Agarista coriifolia var. coriifolia, commonly known as the slender agarista, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with a slightly waxy texture. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family.
